result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Steven Elliott

records.addlTxt: 22R 014270.  $500 paid by DE by Ck#1809 issued from SCSO.  (This check replaces Ck#1673 that was lost by Wells Fargo). cah
Request for Release/ Modification/ Change in Sentence, filed by DE. Includes 22CF79 & 22CF424. Per SJN on 9/2/22- DENIED. JA copied DE. bph

- AMENDED

- Includes 22CF79 & 22CF424

- $1000 already posted on 22CF79. DE to post additional $500 before release. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device [restrictions] prior to release. 

- I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. 

- I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center.  If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- No use or possession of a firearm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Amanda T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:22 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: B Harris,  Defendant Ronald Steven Elliott in court, in custody.   Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Ronald Steven Elliott.  Includes 22CF79 Branch I case & 22CF424 Branch II case.  Court reviews file and questions Atty Dolfi and DE regarding testing issues. Court QUASHES warrant. Bond argument. Court orders bond.  Court administratively transfers 22CF424 to Branch I to trail. Adjourned at 1:30 PM. bph
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Per SJN.  Faxed: Dispatch, Jail, & SCSO. bph

of Absconder Status. Filed by JSC. SEALED. km       to kap

9:04 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for Ronald Steven Elliott. Defendant Ronald Steven Elliott not in court. Set for PH. Court reviews case. Court questions DE's non appearance. Atty Perrin does not know DE's whereabouts. ADA Ellenwood makes statements and requests warrant. Court issues warrant- adjoining states- body only- Stayed until 11AM today. Adjourned 09:07 AM

By self - 22R 008993. jaf
10-14-22 This $500 check was lost by Wells Fargo and they debited our deposit amount for 7-6-22.  SCSO was notified and they issued a stop payment on CK#1673. A new check was issued for DE's bond, CK#1809, received on 10-14-22. cah

01:04 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. District Attorney Karl E Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi appeared on behalf of Defendant for today. Defendant Ronald Steven Elliott in court, in custody. Court reviews file. Atty Perrin recently appointed by PD Office. ADA Dolfi isn't aware if Atty Perrin would be appearing today and requests the preliminary hearing be within time limits. Court sets Preliminary Hearing. Atty Dolfi argues bond modification and requests signature bond. DA Anderson objects. Court will not modify the bond at this time, but may reconsider if information regarding testing at facility is provided. Adjourned at 1:10 PM.  gll
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

12:58 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow with Intern Connor Smith, DF ATTY: Stephanie Kay Schmidt, DF: Ronald Steven Elliott appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Court sets BBH.
